title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
To ensure compliance with GASB Statement 84, the term "Agency Funds" has now been
changed to "Custodial Funds."

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: If a unit needs to act as a custodian to hold non-University of Illinois System funds for

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: an external entity (called the "owner"), the unit may need to create a custodial fund.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The chart below provides examples:

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Typical Status of Fund Owner

paragraph_text:
Payroll/benefit withholding, sales tax
holding, financial aid, other clearing

paragraph_text:
Governments, charities, health
care providers, pension funds

paragraph_text:

Not-for-profit and for-profit

paragraph_text: https://www.busfin.uillinois.edu/bfpp/section-2-agency-funds/policies-managing-agency-funds

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: A custodial fund is a fund held by the system in a purely custodial capacity as a fiscal

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: agent for the owner of the money.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Money Held for Individuals

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system will not hold personal funds of individuals in a fund type 9D custodial

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: fund, unless the individuals are students participating in a study abroad program as

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: outlined in 22 Self-Supporting/Revenue Generating Activities—Account for Study

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Abroad and Unique Instructional Activities.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system will hold funds on behalf of groups of individuals in fund type 9D custodial

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: funds only when they have formalized their relationship through articles of

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: association, bylaws, partnership agreements, or a similar document that establishes

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the group's decision-making protocol and defines the purpose of the group.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Groups of individuals within the system community (primarily faculty, staff, students,

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: or their immediate families) must become either a registered organization or a

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: registered student organization in order for the system to hold their money in a

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: custodial fund. The system will administer the organization's money as a fund type 9G

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: registered organization fund.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: External entity for whom the system creates and manages a custodial fund.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Role of the University of Illinois System

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system acts as a fiscal agent to hold non-system funds for the owner. The

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: custodial fund money is not owned by the system. Owner activities recorded in

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: custodial funds must be consistent with the system’s mission of instruction, research,

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: public service, and economic development. If used in collaboration with system

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: programs, custodial funds must record only the financial activity of the owner, not the

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: system. Unless separately contracted, the system performs only these basic

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: bookkeeping functions for owners:

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Deposits money in a system bank account

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Maintains a record of transactions and balances in the Banner general ledger

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Processes cash receipts, disbursements, and journal entries as directed by the
owner

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Reports transactions and balances to the fund owner

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Issues an IRS Form 1099 for disbursements to external parties paid from the

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: custodial fund as required by the IRS. The system is not responsible for issuing

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 1099s to external parties from any other funds held by the owner.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Reports to the IRS disbursements paid from the custodial fund to non-resident

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system does not pay interest on money held in custodial funds. Additional

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: services may be provided by the system in its discretion and pursuant to an

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: agreement between the unit and the custodial fund owner. For additional information,

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: contact UAFR at uas@uillinois.edu.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Inactive or abandoned balances in custodial funds will be treated as unclaimed

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: property in compliance with State of Illinois requirements.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Role of a Unit

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Before a custodial fund can be established, a system unit must agree to act as liaison

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: between the system and the owner. As liaison, the unit may not assume liability or

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: responsibility for the owner’s actions on the part of the system. For additional

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: information on the responsibilities of the unit, consult 2.4 Comply with Liaison

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Responsibilities for an Custodial Fund.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Role of the Owner

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The owner is ultimately responsible for the management of the financial activity

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: accounted for by the custodial fund. Owners must:

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Perform regular reconciliation of Banner monthly financial reports.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: When asked, provide copies of the reconciliation to the unit.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Supply supporting documentation requested by the system to process

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: transactions.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Maintain a positive cash balance.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: File required sales and other tax returns not prepared by the system.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Maintain organizational documentation, such as income and sales tax exempt
status.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Ensure the organization does not implicitly or explicitly represent itself as a part

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
of the system in publications, through logo use, through use of the system’s tax-
exempt status, etc.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Sign an agreement indicating they understand their responsibilities and agree to
follow the system’s terms for holding money as an agent.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Termination of a Custodial Fund
Relationship

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system may terminate the custodial fund relationship at any time.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system may bill the owner for overdrafts. Owners who repeatedly incur or fail to

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: resolve overdrafts may have their custodial fund relationship with the system

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: terminated.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The system may charge owners for system services provided, overdrafts incurred, or

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: otherwise violating terms and conditions of the custodial fund relationship.

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Related Policies and Procedures

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 10 Obtain Approval as a Cash Handling Unit

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
22 Self-Supporting/Revenue Generating Activities—Account for Study Abroad
and Unique Instructional Activities

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance

title: 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds - Business & Finance

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the Need for a

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
on Behalf of
Owner

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: A University of Illinois System unit must serve as liaison between the system and the

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: owner of money held in a custodial fund. The liaison unit serves as the system's official

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: contact with the owner and is responsible for oversight of the Banner fund that

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: provides a record of the owner's financial transactions and balances. Consult 2.1

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Policies for Managing Custodial Funds.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: If the unit will receive cash as part of its liaison responsibilities, it must be a cash

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: handling unit. For additional information, consult 10 Obtain Approval as a Cash

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Handling Unit.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: To comply with liaison responsibilities for a custodial fund:

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 1. Ensure that the owner understands what services the system does and does

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: not provide.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
2. Ensure the owner understands that it cannot present itself as being part of
the system. For additional information on what to communicate to owners,
consult 2.1 Policies for Managing Custodial Funds.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
3. Obtain the owner's signature on the Custodial Fund Agreement, which is
part of the Banner Fund, Program, Index Code Request form required to

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
establish a custodial fund and keep the signed statement in the unit for five
years after the termination of the custodial relationship.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: https://www.busfin.uillinois.edu/bfpp/section-2-agency-funds/comply-with-liaison-responsibilities

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 4. Request a custodial fund. Consult 2.3 Request Approval for a Custodial

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Fund.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 5. Ensure that the owner (or a responsible member of the owning entity)

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: understands how to transfer money to and from the custodial fund,

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: authorize payments, and obtain financial reports.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 6. Receive, account for, and disburse money on behalf of the owner.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 7. Provide the owner with regular access to reports of their custodial fund

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: transactions and balances.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 8. Perform the following tasks regularly and at fiscal year-end:

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Review custodial fund transactions to ensure the activity remains

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: appropriate for custodial funds according to guidelines provided in 2.2

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Determine the Need for a Custodial Fund.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Review the custodial fund balance to verify it is not in overdraft. If an

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: overdraft exists, do one of the following:

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Work with the owner to eliminate the overdraft within 30 days.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Establish a receivable in Banner Accounts Receivable to charge
the owner for the overdraft. Consult 5 Receivables for further

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: information.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Pursue termination of custodial fund relationship if the fund is

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: consistently in unapproved overdraft status.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 9. Ensure that custodial funds are reconciled and make reconciliations

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
available to University Accounting and Financial Reporting (UAFR) when
requested.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 10. If the owner requests additional services, the system may provide additional

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: services at its discretion under an agreement. Because the process for

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
additional service agreements is currently under review, contact UAFR at
uas@uillinois.edu for information. For more information on basic

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: bookkeeping services, consult "Role of the University of Illinois System" in

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 11. When the system's custodial relationship with the owner is terminated and

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the custodial fund is no longer needed:

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Confirm there are no outstanding bills to pay.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Communicate to all units providing services to the owner that the
relationship has been terminated.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Submit a Disbursement to External Owner from a 9D Custodial Fund

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: form to remit any balance as directed by the owner, to eliminate the

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: fund's cash balance.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
When the Banner custodial fund shows no remaining balance, send an
email to UAFR at uas@uillinois.edu asking to terminate the fund in

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Banner.

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Disbursement to External Owner from a 9D Custodial Fund

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Banner Fund, Program, Index Code Request

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Related Policies and Procedures

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 10 Obtain Approval as a Cash Handling Unit

title: 2.4 Comply with Unit Liaison Responsibilities for a Custodial Fund - Business & Finance

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: University of Illinois System units serving as liaisons between the system and owners

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: of money held in custodial funds are responsible for expending custodial funds at the

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: request of the fund owner. They accomplish this by submitting transactions to initiate

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the expenditure and retaining documentation needed to support the expenditure.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Since these funds are not owned by the system:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Expenditure limits, rates, and policies applicable to system funds do not apply to
custodial funds unless otherwise stated in 2 Custodial Funds.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: State of Illinois procurement regulations do not apply to expenditure of custodial

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: funds unless the owner is an agency, office, or unit of the State of Illinois.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
The system may not procure its own goods and services by expending custodial
funds.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Invoice or other appropriate documentation of the nature and purpose of the

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: expenditure must be obtained and retained by the liaison unit for all expenditure

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: transactions.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: To process a gift to the system from the owner of a custodial fund, see 2.6 Process a

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Transaction between the University and the Owner of a Custodial Fund.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: To return funds to the owner, rather than expend them on the owner's behalf, see 2.7

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Return Custodial Funds to the Owner.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the Need for a

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
on Behalf of
Owner

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: https://www.busfin.uillinois.edu/bfpp/section-2-agency-funds/expend-agency-funds-on-behalf-of-owner

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Liaison units may not expend custodial funds using system purchase orders (Banner

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: or iBuy) unless the owner and system have entered into a contract that provides for

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: use of system purchase orders.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: When the recipient of the expenditure is not a non-resident alien, liaison units may

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: expend custodial funds using one of the following methods, provided the related steps

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: outlined in this process are followed:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Banner journal vouchers, when procuring goods and services from the system.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: PCards or TCards held by the liaison unit, provided system policies, dollar limits,

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: and controls established for use of PCards/TCards are met. PCards/TCards will

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: not be issued directly to owners of custodial funds, and physical possession of

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: cards may not be transferred to non-system personnel. No modifications to

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
system software, profiles, Merchant Category Code groupings, etc. will be made
to accommodate card use on behalf of custodial fund owners. See 7.6 The

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: University Purchasing Card (PCard).

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Emburse Enterprise system.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: needed documentation and confirm the recipient's legal eligibility to receive payment

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: before agreeing to reimburse or procure services from the non-resident alien. Liaison

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: units that do not wish to facilitate these payments must inform the owner prior to

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: executing their Custodial Fund Agreement that:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
The owner may not arrange for services by or reimbursements to a non-resident
alien that will be paid from their custodial fund, and

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: The owner's custodial funds cannot be used to pay non-resident aliens.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: A custodial fund owner cannot use the system sales tax exemption number to avoid

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: custodial fund expenditures for procurement of taxable goods unless the liaison unit

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: has retained on file a copy of the owner's sales tax exemption letter. The liaison unit

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: must provide the owner's sales tax exemption number (and letter if requested) to the

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: vendor at the point of purchase.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: System stores units may, but are not required to, sell goods to owners of custodial

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: funds. Units that sell goods to owners of custodial funds must collect and remit sales

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: tax according to 18.6 Sales and Use Tax/Goods and Services Tax unless the owner

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: or liaison provides a copy of the owner's sales tax exemption letter.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: https://www.busfin.uillinois.edu/bfpp/section-2-agency-funds/expend-agency-funds-on-behalf-of-owner

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: To expend custodial funds on behalf of an owner, follow the procedures below.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
When the recipient of the expenditure is not a non-
resident alien:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 1. Determine whether to make the expenditure using a journal voucher,

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: PCard/TCard, or Emburse Enterprise.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Use a journal voucher when:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Procuring goods or services from a system unit, or

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Correcting an error in the original posting of a Banner transaction

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
as described in 2.6 Process a Transaction between the University
and the Owner of a Custodial Fund.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Use a PCard/TCard when procuring goods or services from an external

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: vendor.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Use Emburse Enterprise when:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Procuring goods and services from an external vendor, or

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Reimbursing an individual for payments made on behalf of the

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: owner.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 2. Process the transaction:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: If using a journal voucher:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Verify that the transaction is adequately supported as an expenditure
made on behalf of the owner and that adequate invoice documentation

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: to explain the purpose of the expenditure is retained in unit files.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Verify that the expenditure (in conjunction with any other pending
expenditures) will not create an overdraft in the custodial fund. If an

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
overdraft will be created, obtain additional funding from the owner or
discuss with University Accounting and Financial Reporting (UAFR)
prior to processing the expenditure.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
If procurement of goods are from a system storeroom, assure that sales
tax is included in the payment unless the owner’s sales tax exemption
documentation (not the University of Illinois System sales tax exempt

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
identification number) is provided to the storeroom as required in the
Policy Statement above.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Process the journal voucher in Banner.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: If using a PCard or TCard

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Verify that the transaction is adequately supported as an expenditure

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
made on behalf of the owner and that adequate invoice documentation
to explain the purpose of the expenditure is retained in unit files.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Verify that the transaction will not violate any system limits or policies
for card usage.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
overdraft will be created, obtain additional funding from the owner or
discuss with UAFR prior to processing the expenditure.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: When procuring goods, assure that sales tax is included in the payment

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
unless the owner’s sales tax exemption documentation (not the
system’s sales tax exempt identification number) is provided to the
vendor as required in Before You Begin above. Caution: When using a

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
PCard or TCard for web purchases, make sure that any system sales tax
exemption defaults are not applied.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Process the card transaction with the vendor.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: If using the Emburse Enterprise System:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Obtain a completed Expenditure from 9D Custodial Funds form from

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: the owner or an authorized representative of the owner organization.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Verify that adequate invoice documentation to explain the purpose of
the expenditure is retained in unit files.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Verify the payee is not a non-resident alien. If the payee is a non-
resident alien, follow the appropriate process in the section below.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Determine payee vendor identification number in the Accounts

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Payable system and enter it on the Expenditure from 9D Custodial
Funds form. If the payee does not have a vendor identification number,
request one. To determine how to identify or request a vendor

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: identification number, consult Vendor Setup.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Sign the liaison attestation on the authorization form.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
When procuring goods, assure that sales tax is included in the payment
unless the owner’s sales tax exemption documentation (not the
system’s sales tax exempt identification number) is provided to the

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: vendor as required in Before You Begin above.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Process the disbursement transaction in the Emburse Enterprise

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: system, attaching the fully completed

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Expenditure from 9D Custodial Funds form and any other

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: documentation needed to support the transaction.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 3. Verify that the expenditure is accurately recorded in the custodial fund.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
When the recipient of the expenditure is a non-
resident alien:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 1. Verify that payments to the individual are permissible prior to contracting

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: for services from or agreeing to reimburse the individual by following these

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: steps:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: Obtain payee visa status.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
See Payments to Foreign Nationals to determine payment eligibility
and required documentation.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Consult with the Office of University Payroll and Benefits (UPB) to
address any questions not resolved by referring to the website.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: When required documents and information have been obtained,

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: submit them to UPB to verify that the payment is permissible.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 2. After confirming the payment is permissible, inform the individual that they

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: may provide services or acquire goods or services for reimbursement.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 3. After the individual has performed the service or acquired the goods or

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: services:

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text:
Complete the Expenditure from 9D Custodial Funds form and
forward it to UPB to generate the payment.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
paragraph_text: 4. Verify that the expenditure is accurately recorded in the custodial fund.

title: 2.5 Expend Custodial Funds on Behalf of Owner - Business & Finance
